133 double nrn_netcon_get_delay(NetCon* nc) { return nc->delay_; }

139 double nrn_event_queue_stats(double* stats) {
140 #if COLLECT_TQueue_STATISTICS
141  net_cvode_instance_event_queue(nrn_threads)->spike_stat(stats);
142  return (stats[0]-stats[2]);
143 #else
144  return -1.;
145 #endif

147 double nrn_netcon_get_thresh(NetCon* nc) {
148  if (nc->src_) {
149  return nc->src_->threshold_;
150  }else{
151  return 0;
152  }
153 }
154 void nrn_netcon_set_thresh(NetCon* nc, double th) {
155  if (nc->src_) {
156  nc->src_->threshold_ = th;
157  }

170 int nrn_netcon_info(NetCon* nc, double **pw, Point_process **target,
171  double **th, double **del) {
172  *target=(nc->target_)? nc->target_:(Point_process*)0;
173  *th=(nc->src_)?&(nc->src_->threshold_):(double*)0;
174  *del=&nc->delay_;
175  *pw = nc->weight_;
176  return nc->cnt_;
177 }

200 
201 #if USENCS
202 // As a subroutine for NCS, NEURON simulates the cells of a subnet
203 // (usually a single cell) and NCS manages whatever intercellular
204 // NetCon connections were specified by the hoc cvode method
205 // Cvode.ncs_netcons(List nc_inlist, List nc_outlist) . The former list
206 // is normally in one to one correspondence with all the synapses. These
207 // NetCon objects have those synapses as targets and nil sources.
208 // The latter list is normally in one to one correspondence with
209 // the cells of the subnet. Those NetCon objects have sources of the form
210 // cell.axon.v(1) and nil targets.
211 // Note that the program that creates the hoc file knows
212 // how to tell NCS that a particular integer corresponds to a particular
213 // NetCon
214 
215 // NCS tells NEURON what time to integrate to. (Using any integration method)
216 // Probably the step size will be the minimum delay between output spike
217 // and its effect on any synapse.
218 // void ncs2nrn_integrate(double tstop);
219 
220 // NCS gives synaptic events to NEURON but tdeliver must be >= t
221 void ncs2nrn_inputevent(int netcon_input_index, double tdeliver);
222 
223 // and NEURON notifies NCS if cell ouputs a spike during integrate
224 extern void nrn2ncs_outputevent(int netcon_output_index, double firetime);
225 
226 // netcon_input_index specifies the NetCon object
227 // in the following list. The hoc file sets this up via cvode.ncs_netcons
228 static NetConPList* ncs2nrn_input_;
229 
230 // the netcon_ouput_index is specified in a NetCon field called
231 // nrn2ncs_output_index_
232 
233 // helper functions
234 void nrn2ncs_netcons();
235 #endif
236 #if NRNMPI
237 extern void nrn2ncs_outputevent(int netcon_output_index, double firetime);
238 #endif
239 }; //extern "C"

327 DiscreteEvent* PlayRecordEvent::savestate_save() {
328  PlayRecordEvent* pre = new PlayRecordEvent();
329  pre->plr_ = plr_;
330  return pre;
331 }
332 void PlayRecordEvent::savestate_restore(double tt, NetCvode* nc) {
333  nc->event(tt, plr_->event(), nrn_threads + plr_->ith_);
334 }
335 void PlayRecordEvent::savestate_write(FILE* f) {
336  fprintf(f, "%d\n", PlayRecordEventType);
337  fprintf(f, "%d %d\n", plr_->type(), net_cvode_instance->playrec_item(plr_));
338 }
339 
340 DiscreteEvent* PlayRecordEvent::savestate_read(FILE* f) {
341  DiscreteEvent* de = nil;
342  char buf[100];
343  int type, plr_index;
344  nrn_assert(fgets(buf, 100, f));
345  sscanf(buf, "%d %d\n", &type, &plr_index);
346  PlayRecord* plr = net_cvode_instance->playrec_item(plr_index);
347  assert(plr && plr->type() == type);
348  return plr->event()->savestate_save();
349 }
350 
351 PlayRecordSave* PlayRecord::savestate_save() {
352  return new PlayRecordSave(this);
353 }
354 
355 PlayRecordSave* PlayRecord::savestate_read(FILE* f) {
356  PlayRecordSave* prs = nil;
357  int type, index;
358  char buf[100];
359  nrn_assert(fgets(buf, 100, f));
360  nrn_assert(sscanf(buf, "%d %d\n", &type, &index) == 2);
361  PlayRecord* plr = net_cvode_instance->playrec_item(index);
362  assert(plr->type() == type);
363  switch (type) {
364  case VecRecordDiscreteType:
365  prs = new VecRecordDiscreteSave(plr);
366  break;
367  case VecRecordDtType:
368  prs = new VecRecordDtSave(plr);
369  break;
370  case VecPlayStepType:
371  prs = new VecPlayStepSave(plr);
372  break;
373  case VecPlayContinuousType:
374  prs = new VecPlayContinuousSave(plr);
375  break;
376  default:
377  // whenever there is no subclass specific data to save
378  prs = new PlayRecordSave(plr);
379  break;
380  }
381  prs->savestate_read(f);
382  return prs;
383 }
384 
385 PlayRecordSave::PlayRecordSave(PlayRecord* plr) {
386  pr_ = plr;
387  prl_index_ = net_cvode_instance->playrec_item(pr_);
388  assert(prl_index_ >= 0);
389 }
390 PlayRecordSave::~PlayRecordSave() {
391 }
392 void PlayRecordSave::check() {
393  assert(pr_ == net_cvode_instance->playrec_item(prl_index_));
394 }
395 
396 void NetCon::chksrc() {
397  if (!src_) {
398  hoc_execerror(hoc_object_name(obj_), "source is missing");
399  }
400 }
401 void NetCon::chktar() {
402  if (!target_) {
403  hoc_execerror(hoc_object_name(obj_), "target is missing");
404  }
405 }
406 
407 void NetCon::disconnect(Observable* o) {
408  Object* ob = ((ObjObservable*)o)->object();
409 //printf("%s disconnect from ", hoc_object_name(obj_));
410  if (target_->ob == ob) {
411 //printf("target %s\n", hoc_object_name(target_->ob));
412  target_ = nil;
413  active_ = 0;
414  }
415 }
416 
417 #if 0 // way of printing dinfo
418 printf("NetCon from %s to ",
419 d->src_->osrc_ ? hoc_object_name(d->src_->osrc_) : secname(d->src_->ssrc_));
420 printf("%s ", hoc_object_name(d->target_->ob));
421 printf(" weight index=%d\n", l);
422 #endif

455 // allows marshalling of all items in the event queue that need to be
456 // removed to avoid duplicates due to frecord_init after finitialize
457 static TQList* record_init_items_;
458 
459 static DiscreteEvent* null_event_;

461 
462 static PreSyn* unused_presyn; // holds the NetCons with no source
463 
464 static double nc_preloc(void* v) { // user must pop section stack after call
465  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
466  Section* s = nil;
467  if (d->src_) {
468  s = d->src_->ssrc_;
469  }
470  if (s) {
471  nrn_pushsec(s);
472  double* v = d->src_->thvar_;
473  nrn_parent_info(s); // make sure parentnode exists
474  // there is no efficient search for the location of
475  // an arbitrary variable. Search only for v at 0 - 1.
476  // Otherwise return .5 .
477  if (v == &NODEV(s->parentnode)) {
478  return nrn_arc_position(s, s->parentnode);
479  }
480  for (int i = 0; i < s->nnode; ++i) {
481  if (v == &NODEV(s->pnode[i])) {
482  return nrn_arc_position(s, s->pnode[i]);
483  }
484  }
485  return -2.; // not voltage
486  }else{
487  return -1.;
488  }
489 }
490 
491 static Object** nc_preseg(void* v) { // user must pop section stack after call
492  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
493  Section* s = NULL;
494  Object* obj = NULL;
495  double x = -1.;
496  if (d->src_) {
497  s = d->src_->ssrc_;
498  }
499  if (s && nrnpy_seg_from_sec_x) {
500  double* v = d->src_->thvar_;
501  nrn_parent_info(s); // make sure parentnode exists
502  // there is no efficient search for the location of
503  // an arbitrary variable. Search only for v at 0 - 1.
504  // Otherwise return NULL.
505  if (v == &NODEV(s->parentnode)) {
506  x = nrn_arc_position(s, s->parentnode);
507  }
508  for (int i = 0; i < s->nnode; ++i) {
509  if (v == &NODEV(s->pnode[i])) {
510  x = nrn_arc_position(s, s->pnode[i]);
511  continue;
512  }
513  }
514  // perhaps should search for v
515  if (x >= 0) {
516  obj = (*nrnpy_seg_from_sec_x)(s, x);
517  --obj->refcount;
518  }
519  }
520  return hoc_temp_objptr(obj);
521 }
522 
523 static double nc_postloc(void* v) { // user must pop section stack after call
524  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
525  if (d->target_ && d->target_->sec) {
526  nrn_pushsec(d->target_->sec);
527  return nrn_arc_position(d->target_->sec, d->target_->node);
528  }else{
529  return -1.;
530  }
531 }
532 
533 static Object** nc_postseg(void* v) { // user must pop section stack after call
534  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
535  Object* obj = NULL;
536  if (d->target_ && d->target_->sec && nrnpy_seg_from_sec_x) {
537  double x = nrn_arc_position(d->target_->sec, d->target_->node);
538  obj = (*nrnpy_seg_from_sec_x)(d->target_->sec, x);
539  --obj->refcount;
540  }
541  return hoc_temp_objptr(obj);
542 }
543 
544 static Object** nc_syn(void* v) {
545  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
546  Object* ob = nil;
547  if (d->target_) {
548  ob = d->target_->ob;
549  }
550  return hoc_temp_objptr(ob);
551 }
552 
553 static Object** nc_pre(void* v) {
554  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
555  Object* ob = nil;
556  if (d->src_) {
557  ob = d->src_->osrc_;
558  }
559  return hoc_temp_objptr(ob);
560 }
561 
562 static Object** newoclist(int i, OcList*& o) {
563  Object** po;
564  if (ifarg(i) && hoc_is_object_arg(i)) {
565  po = hoc_objgetarg(i);
566  check_obj_type(*po, "List");
567  o = (OcList*)((*po)->u.this_pointer);
568  }else{
569  o = new OcList();
570  o->ref();
571  Symbol* sl = hoc_lookup("List");
572  po = hoc_temp_objvar(sl, o);
573  }
574  return po;
575 }
576 
577 static Object** nc_prelist(void* v) {
578  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
579  OcList* o;
580  Object** po = newoclist(1, o);
581  if (d->src_) {
582  NetConPList& dil = d->src_->dil_;
583  for (int i=0; i < dil.count(); ++i) {
584  if (dil.item(i)->obj_) {
585  o->append(dil.item(i)->obj_);
586  }
587  }
588  }
589  return po;
590 }
591 
592 static Object** nc_synlist(void* v) {
593  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
594  OcList* o;
595  Object** po = newoclist(1, o);
596  hoc_Item* q;
597  if (net_cvode_instance->psl_) ITERATE(q, net_cvode_instance->psl_) {
598  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
599  NetConPList& dil = ps->dil_;
600  for (int i=0; i < dil.count(); ++i) {
601  NetCon* d1 = dil.item(i);
602  if (d1->obj_ && d1->target_ == d->target_) {
603  o->append(d1->obj_);
604  }
605  }
606  }
607  return po;
608 }
609 
610 static Object** nc_postcelllist(void* v) {
611  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
612  OcList* o;
613  Object** po = newoclist(1, o);
614  hoc_Item* q;
615  Object* cell = nil;
616  if (d->target_ && d->target_->sec) {
617  cell = nrn_sec2cell(d->target_->sec);
618  }
619  if (cell && net_cvode_instance->psl_) ITERATE(q, net_cvode_instance->psl_) {
620  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
621  NetConPList& dil = ps->dil_;
622  for (int i=0; i < dil.count(); ++i) {
623  NetCon* d1 = dil.item(i);
624  if (d1->obj_ && d1->target_
625  && nrn_sec2cell_equals(d1->target_->sec, cell)) {
626  o->append(d1->obj_);
627  }
628  }
629  }
630  return po;
631 }
632 
633 static Object** nc_precelllist(void* v) {
634  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
635  OcList* o;
636  Object** po = newoclist(1, o);
637  hoc_Item* q;
638  Object* cell = nil;
639  if (d->src_ && d->src_->ssrc_) { cell = nrn_sec2cell(d->src_->ssrc_);}
640  if (cell && net_cvode_instance->psl_) ITERATE(q, net_cvode_instance->psl_) {
641  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
642  NetConPList& dil = ps->dil_;
643  for (int i=0; i < dil.count(); ++i) {
644  NetCon* d1 = dil.item(i);
645  if (d1->obj_ && d1->src_ && ps->ssrc_
646  && nrn_sec2cell_equals(ps->ssrc_, cell)) {
647  o->append(d1->obj_);
648  }
649  }
650  }
651  return po;
652 }
653 
654 static Object** nc_precell(void* v) {
655  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
656  if (d->src_ && d->src_->ssrc_) {
657  return hoc_temp_objptr(nrn_sec2cell(d->src_->ssrc_));
658  }else{
659  return hoc_temp_objptr(0);
660  }
661 }
662 
663 static Object** nc_postcell(void* v) {
664  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
665  Object* ob = nil;
666  if (d->target_ && d->target_->sec) {
667  ob = nrn_sec2cell(d->target_->sec);
668  }
669  return hoc_temp_objptr(ob);
670 }
671 
672 static double nc_setpost(void* v) {
673  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
674  Object* otar = nil;
675  if (ifarg(1)) {
676  otar = *hoc_objgetarg(1);
677  }
678  if (otar && !is_point_process(otar)) {
679  hoc_execerror("argument must be a point process or NULLobject",0);
680  }
681  Point_process* tar = nil;
682  if (otar) {
683  tar = ob2pntproc(otar);
684  }
685  if (d->target_ && d->target_ != tar) {
686 #if DISCRETE_EVENT_OBSERVER
687  ObjObservable::Detach(d->target_->ob, d);
688 #endif
689  d->target_ = nil;
690  }
691  int cnt = 1;
692  if (tar) {
693  cnt = pnt_receive_size[tar->prop->type];
694  d->target_ = tar;
695 #if DISCRETE_EVENT_OBSERVER
696  ObjObservable::Attach(otar, d);
697 #endif
698  }else{
699  d->active_ = false;
700  }
701  if (d->cnt_ != cnt) {
702  d->cnt_ = cnt;
703  delete [] d->weight_;
704  d->weight_ = new double[d->cnt_];
705  }
706  return 0.;
707 }
708 
709 static double nc_valid(void* v) {
710  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
711  hoc_return_type_code = 2;
712  if (d->src_ && d->target_) {
713  return 1.;
714  }
715  return 0.;
716 }
717 
718 static double nc_active(void* v) {
719  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
720  bool a = d->active_;
721  if (d->target_ && ifarg(1)) {
722  d->active_ = bool(chkarg(1, 0, 1));
723  }
724  hoc_return_type_code = 2;
725  return double(a);
726 }
727 
728 // for threads, revised net_send to use absolute time (in the
729 // mod file we add the thread time when we call it).
730 // And we can no longer check with respect to minimum time in chkarg
731 static double nc_event(void* v) {
732  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
733  double td = chkarg(1, -1e20,1e20);
734  if (d->active_ == 0) { return 0.0; }
735  d->chktar();
736  NrnThread* nt = PP2NT(d->target_);
737  if (!nt || nt < nrn_threads || nt > (nrn_threads+(nrn_nthread-1))){
738 //printf("%s.event %s\n", hoc_object_name(d->obj_), "target does not know its thread yet.");
739  return 0.0;
740  }
741  if (ifarg(2)) {
742  double flag = *getarg(2);
743  Point_process* pnt = d->target_;
744  int type = pnt->prop->type;
745  if (!nrn_is_artificial_[type]) {
746  hoc_execerror("Can only send fake self-events to ARTIFICIAL_CELLs",0);
747  }
748  void** pq = (void**)(&pnt->prop->dparam[nrn_artcell_qindex_[type]]._pvoid);
749  net_send(pq, d->weight_, pnt, td, flag);
750  }else{
751  net_cvode_instance->event(td, d, PP2NT(d->target_));
752  }
753  return (double)d->active_;
754 }
755 static double nc_record(void* v) {
756  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
757  d->chksrc();
758  if (ifarg(1)) {
759  if (ifarg(2)) {
760  int recid = d->obj_->index;
761  if (ifarg(3)) {
762  recid = (int)(*getarg(3));
763  }
764  d->src_->record(vector_arg(1), vector_arg(2), recid);
765  }else if (hoc_is_str_arg(1)) {
766  d->src_->record_stmt(gargstr(1));
767  }else if (is_vector_arg(1)){
768  d->src_->record(vector_arg(1));
769  }else{
770  d->src_->record_stmt(*hoc_objgetarg(1));
771  }
772  }else{
773  d->src_->record((IvocVect*)nil);
774  }
775  return 0;
776 }
777 
778 static double nc_srcgid(void* v) {
779  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
780  hoc_return_type_code = 1;
781  if (d->src_) {
782  return (double)d->src_->gid_;
783  }
784  return -1.;
785 }
786 
787 static Object** nc_get_recordvec(void* v) {
788  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
789  Object* ob = nil;
790  if (d->src_ && d->src_->tvec_) {
791  ob = d->src_->tvec_->obj_;
792  }
793  return hoc_temp_objptr(ob);
794 }
795 
796 static double nc_wcnt(void* v) {
797  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
798  return d->cnt_;
799 }
800 
801 static Member_func members[] = {
802  "active", nc_active,
803  "valid", nc_valid,
804  "preloc", nc_preloc,
805  "postloc", nc_postloc,
806  "setpost", nc_setpost,
807  "event", nc_event,
808  "record", nc_record,
809  "srcgid", nc_srcgid,
810  "wcnt", nc_wcnt,
811  "delay", 0, // these four changed below
812  "weight", 0,
813  "threshold", 0,
814  "x", 0,
815  0, 0
816 };
817 
818 static Member_ret_obj_func omembers[] = {
819  "syn", nc_syn,
820  "pre", nc_pre,
821  "precell", nc_precell,
822  "postcell", nc_postcell,
823  "preseg", nc_preseg,
824  "postseg", nc_postseg,
825  "prelist", nc_prelist,
826  "synlist", nc_synlist,
827  "precelllist", nc_precelllist,
828  "postcelllist", nc_postcelllist,
829  "get_recordvec", nc_get_recordvec,
830  0, 0
831 };
832 
833 static void steer_val(void* v) {
834  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
835  Symbol* s = hoc_spop();
836  if (strcmp(s->name, "delay") == 0) {
837  d->chksrc();
838  hoc_pushpx(&d->delay_);
839  d->src_->use_min_delay_ = 0;
840  }else if (strcmp(s->name, "weight") == 0) {
841  int index = 0;
842  if (hoc_stacktype() == NUMBER) {
843  s->arayinfo->sub[0] = d->cnt_;
844  index = hoc_araypt(s, SYMBOL);
845  }
846  hoc_pushpx(d->weight_ + index);
847  }else if (strcmp(s->name, "x") == 0) {
848  static double dummy = 0.;
849  d->chksrc();
850  if (d->src_->thvar_) {
851  hoc_pushpx(d->src_->thvar_);
852  }else{
853  dummy = 0.;
854  hoc_pushpx(&dummy);
855  }
856  }else if (strcmp(s->name, "threshold") == 0) {
857  d->chksrc();
858  hoc_pushpx(&d->src_->threshold_);
859  }
860 }
861 
862 static void* cons(Object* o) {
863  NetCon* d;
864  if (!net_cvode_instance) {
865  hoc_execerror("CVode instance must exist", 0);
866  }
867  // source, target, threshold, delay, magnitude
868  Object* osrc = nil, *otar;
869  Section* srcsec = nil;
870  double* psrc = nil;
871  if (hoc_is_object_arg(1)) {
872  osrc = *hoc_objgetarg(1);
873  if (osrc && !is_point_process(osrc)) {
874  hoc_execerror("if arg 1 is an object it must be a point process or NULLObject", 0);
875  }
876  }else{
877  psrc = hoc_pgetarg(1);
878  srcsec = chk_access();
879  }
880  otar = *hoc_objgetarg(2);
881  if (otar && !is_point_process(otar)) {
882  hoc_execerror("arg 2 must be a point process or NULLobject", 0);
883  }
884  double thresh = -1.e9; // sentinal value. default is 10 if new PreSyn
885  double delay = 1.;
886  double weight = 0.;
887 
888  if (ifarg(3)) {
889  thresh = *getarg(3);
890  delay = chkarg(4, 0, 1e15);
891  weight = *getarg(5);
892  }
893  d = net_cvode_instance->install_deliver(psrc, srcsec, osrc, otar,
894  thresh, delay, weight);
895  d->obj_ = o;
896  return (void*)d;
897 }
898 
899 static void destruct(void* v) {
900  NetCon* d = (NetCon*)v;
901  delete d;
902 }
903 
904 void NetCon_reg() {
905  class2oc("NetCon", cons, destruct, members, NULL, omembers, NULL);
906  Symbol* nc = hoc_lookup("NetCon");
907  nc->u.ctemplate->steer = steer_val;
908  Symbol* s;
909  s = hoc_table_lookup("delay", nc->u.ctemplate->symtable);
910  s->type = VAR;
911  s->arayinfo = nil;
912  s = hoc_table_lookup("x", nc->u.ctemplate->symtable);
913  s->type = VAR;
914  s->arayinfo = nil;
915  s = hoc_table_lookup("threshold", nc->u.ctemplate->symtable);
916  s->type = VAR;
917  s->arayinfo = nil;
918  s = hoc_table_lookup("weight", nc->u.ctemplate->symtable);
919  s->type = VAR;
920  s->arayinfo = new Arrayinfo;
921  s->arayinfo->refcount = 1;
922  s->arayinfo->a_varn = nil;
923  s->arayinfo->nsub = 1;
924  s->arayinfo->sub[0] = 1;
925 }
926 
927 static char* escape_bracket(const char* s) {
928  static char* b;
929  const char* p1;
930  char* p2;
931  if (!b) {
932  b = new char[256];
933  }
934  for (p1 = s, p2 = b; *p1; ++p1, ++p2) {
935  switch (*p1) {
936  case '<':
937  *p2 = '[';
938  break;
939  case '>':
940  *p2 = ']';
941  break;
942  case '[':
943  case ']':
944  *p2 = '\\';
945  *(++p2) = *p1;
946  break;
947  default:
948  *p2 = *p1;
949  break;
950  }
951  }
952  *p2 = '\0';
953  return b;
954 }
955 
956 Object** NetCvode::netconlist() {
957  // interface to cvode.netconlist(precell, postcell, target, [list])
958  OcList* o;
959 
960  Object** po = newoclist(4, o);
961 
962  Object *opre = nil, *opost = nil, *otar = nil;
963  Regexp* spre = nil, *spost = nil, *star = nil;
964  char* s;
965  int n;
966 
967  if (hoc_is_object_arg(1)) {
968  opre = *hoc_objgetarg(1);
969  }else{
970  s = gargstr(1);
971  if (s[0] == '\0') {
972  spre = new Regexp(".*");
973  }else{
974  spre = new Regexp(escape_bracket(s));
975  }
976  if(!spre->pattern()) {
977  hoc_execerror(gargstr(1), "not a valid regular expression");
978  }
979  }
980  if (hoc_is_object_arg(2)) {
981  opost = *hoc_objgetarg(2);
982  }else{
983  s = gargstr(2);
984  if (s[0] == '\0') {
985  spost = new Regexp(".*");
986  }else{
987  spost = new Regexp(escape_bracket(s));
988  }
989  if(!spost->pattern()) {
990  hoc_execerror(gargstr(2), "not a valid regular expression");
991  }
992  }
993  if (hoc_is_object_arg(3)) {
994  otar = *hoc_objgetarg(3);
995  }else{
996  s = gargstr(3);
997  if (s[0] == '\0') {
998  star = new Regexp(".*");
999  }else{
1000  star = new Regexp(escape_bracket(s));
1001  }
1002  if(!star->pattern()) {
1003  hoc_execerror(gargstr(3), "not a valid regular expression");
1004  }
1005  }
1006 
1007  bool b;
1008  hoc_Item* q;
1009  if (psl_) ITERATE(q, psl_) {
1010  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
1011  b = false;
1012  if (ps->ssrc_) {
1013  Object* precell = nrn_sec2cell(ps->ssrc_);
1014  if (opre) {
1015  if (precell == opre) {
1016  b = true;
1017  }else{
1018  b = false;
1019  }
1020  }else{
1021  s = hoc_object_name(precell);
1022  n = strlen(s);
1023  if (spre->Match(s, n, 0) > 0) {
1024  b = true;
1025  }else{
1026  b = false;
1027  }
1028  }
1029  }else if (ps->osrc_) {
1030  Object* presyn = ps->osrc_;
1031  if (opre) {
1032  if (presyn == opre) {
1033  b = true;
1034  }else{
1035  b = false;
1036  }
1037  }else{
1038  s = hoc_object_name(presyn);
1039  n = strlen(s);
1040  if (spre->Match(s, n, 0) > 0) {
1041  b = true;
1042  }else{
1043  b = false;
1044  }
1045  }
1046  }
1047  if (b == true) {
1048  NetConPList& dil = ps->dil_;
1049  for (int i=0; i < dil.count(); ++i) {
1050  NetCon* d = dil.item(i);
1051  Object* postcell = nil;
1052  Object* target = nil;
1053  if (d->target_) {
1054  Point_process* p = d->target_;
1055  target = p->ob;
1056  if (p->sec) {
1057  postcell = nrn_sec2cell(p->sec);
1058  }
1059  }
1060  if (opost) {
1061  if (postcell == opost) {
1062  b = true;
1063  }else{
1064  b = false;
1065  }
1066  }else{
1067  s = hoc_object_name(postcell);
1068  n = strlen(s);
1069  if (spost->Match(s, n, 0) > 0) {
1070  b = true;
1071  }else{
1072  b = false;
1073  }
1074  }
1075  if (b == true) {
1076  if (otar) {
1077  if (target == otar) {
1078  b = true;
1079  }else{
1080  b = false;
1081  }
1082  }else{
1083  s = hoc_object_name(target);
1084  n = strlen(s);
1085  if (star->Match(s, n, 0) > 0) {
1086  b = true;
1087  }else{
1088  b = false;
1089  }
1090  }
1091  if (b == true) {
1092  o->append(d->obj_);
1093  }
1094  }
1095  }
1096  }
1097  }
1098  if (spre) delete spre;
1099  if (spost) delete spost;
1100  if (star) delete star;
1101  return po;
1102 }
1103 
1104 #define ITE_SIZE 10
1105 NetCvodeThreadData::NetCvodeThreadData() {
1106  tpool_ = new TQItemPool(1000, 1);
1107  // tqe_ accessed only by thread i so no locking
1108  tqe_ = new TQueue(tpool_, 0);
1109  sepool_ = new SelfEventPool(1000,1);
1110  selfqueue_ = nil;
1111  psl_thr_ = nil;
1112  tq_ = nil;
1113  lcv_ = nil;
1114  ite_size_ = ITE_SIZE;
1115  ite_cnt_ = 0;
1116  unreffed_event_cnt_ = 0;
1117  immediate_deliver_ = -1e100;
1118  inter_thread_events_ = new InterThreadEvent[ite_size_];
1119  nlcv_ = 0;
1120  MUTCONSTRUCT(1)
1121 }
1122 
1123 NetCvodeThreadData::~NetCvodeThreadData() {
1124  delete [] inter_thread_events_;
1125  if (psl_thr_) { hoc_l_freelist(&psl_thr_); }
1126  if (tq_) { delete tq_; }
1127  delete tqe_;
1128  delete tpool_;
1129  if (selfqueue_) {
1130  selfqueue_->remove_all();
1131  delete selfqueue_;
1132  }
1133  delete sepool_;
1134  if (lcv_) {
1135  for (int i=0; i < nlcv_; ++i) {
1136  net_cvode_instance->delete_list(lcv_ + i);
1137  }
1138  delete [] lcv_;
1139  }
1140  MUTDESTRUCT
1141 }
1142 
1143 void NetCvodeThreadData::interthread_send(double td, DiscreteEvent* db, NrnThread* nt) {
1144  //bin_event(td, db, nt);
1145  MUTLOCK
1146 #if PRINT_EVENT
1147 if (net_cvode_instance->print_event_) {
1148 Printf("interthread send td=%.15g DE type=%d thread=%d target=%d %s\n",
1149 td, db->type(), nt->id, (db->type() == 2) ? PP2NT(((NetCon*)db)->target_)->id:-1,
1150 (db->type() == 2) ? hoc_object_name(((NetCon*)(db))->target_->ob):"?");
1151 }
1152 #endif
1153  if(ite_cnt_ >= ite_size_) {
1154  ite_size_ *= 2;
1155  InterThreadEvent* in = new InterThreadEvent[ite_size_];
1156  for (int i=0; i < ite_cnt_; ++i) {
1157  in[i].de_ = inter_thread_events_[i].de_;
1158  in[i].t_ = inter_thread_events_[i].t_;
1159  }
1160  delete [] inter_thread_events_;
1161  inter_thread_events_ = in;
1162  }
1163  InterThreadEvent& ite = inter_thread_events_[ite_cnt_++];
1164  ite.de_ = db;
1165  ite.t_ = td;
1166  // race since each NetCvodeThreadData has its own lock and enqueueing_
1167  // is a NetCvode instance variable. enqueuing_ is not logically
1168  // needed but can avoid a nrn_multithread_job call in allthread_least_t
1169  // which does nothing if there are no interthread events.
1170  //int& b = net_cvode_instance->enqueueing_;
1171  //if (!b) { b = 1; }
1172  MUTUNLOCK
1173  // have decided to lock net_cvode_instance and set it
1174  net_cvode_instance->set_enqueueing();
1175 }
1176 
1177 void NetCvodeThreadData::enqueue(NetCvode* nc, NrnThread* nt) {
1178  int i;
1179  MUTLOCK
1180  for (i = 0; i < ite_cnt_; ++i) {
1181  InterThreadEvent& ite = inter_thread_events_[i];
1182 #if PRINT_EVENT
1183 if (net_cvode_instance->print_event_) {
1184 Printf("interthread enqueue td=%.15g DE type=%d thread=%d target=%d %s\n",
1185 ite.t_, ite.de_->type(), nt->id, (ite.de_->type() == 2) ? PP2NT(((NetCon*)(ite.de_))->target_)->id:-1,
1186 (ite.de_->type() == 2) ? hoc_object_name(((NetCon*)(ite.de_))->target_->ob):"?");
1187 }
1188 #endif
1189  nc->bin_event(ite.t_, ite.de_, nt);
1190  }
1191  ite_cnt_ = 0;
1192  MUTUNLOCK
1193 }
1194 
1195 NetCvode::NetCvode(bool single) {
1196  use_long_double_ = 0;
1197  empty_ = true; // no equations (only artificial cells).
1198  MUTCONSTRUCT(0);
1199  maxorder_ = 5;
1200  maxstep_ = 1e9;
1201  minstep_ = 0.;
1202  rtol_ = 0.;
1203  atol_ = 1e-3;
1204  jacobian_ = 0;
1205  stiff_ = 2;
1206  mst_ = nil;
1207  condition_order_ = 1;
1208  null_event_ = new DiscreteEvent();
1209  tstop_event_ = new TstopEvent();
1210  eps_ = 100.*UNIT_ROUNDOFF;
1211  hdp_ = nil;
1212  print_event_ = 0;
1213  nrn_use_fifo_queue_ = false;
1214  single_ = single;
1215  nrn_use_daspk_ = false;
1216  gcv_ = nil;
1217  wl_list_ = new HTListList();
1218  allthread_hocevents_ = new HocEventList();
1219  pcnt_ = 0;
1220  p = nil;
1221  p_construct(1);
1222  // eventually these should not have to be thread safe
1223  pst_ = nil;
1224  pst_cnt_ = 0;
1225  psl_ = nil;
1226  // for parallel network simulations hardly any presyns have
1227  // a threshold and it can be very inefficient to check the entire
1228  // presyn list for thresholds during the fixed step method.
1229  // So keep a threshold list.
1230  unused_presyn = nil;
1231  structure_change_cnt_ = -1;
1232  fornetcon_change_cnt_ = -2;
1233  matrix_change_cnt_ = -1;
1234  playrec_change_cnt_ = 0;
1235  alloc_list();
1236  prl_ = new PlayRecList(10);
1237  fixed_play_ = new PlayRecList(10);
1238  fixed_record_ = new PlayRecList(10);
1239  vec_event_store_ = nil;
1240  if (!record_init_items_) {
1241  record_init_items_ = new TQList();
1242  }
1243 // re_init(t);
1244 }
1245 
1246 NetCvode::~NetCvode() {
1247  MUTDESTRUCT
1248  if (net_cvode_instance == (NetCvode*)this) {
1249  net_cvode_instance = nil;
1250  }
1251  if (hdp_) {
1252  hdp_ = nil;
1253  }
1254  delete_list();
1255  p_construct(0);
1256  if (mst_) {
1257  // and should also iterate and delete the MaxStateItem
1258  delete mst_;
1259  }
1260  if (psl_) {
1261  hoc_Item* q;
1262  ITERATE(q, psl_) {
1263  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
1264  for (int i = ps->dil_.count() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
1265  NetCon* d = ps->dil_.item(i);
1266  d->src_ = nil;
1267  delete d;
1268  }
1269  delete ps;
1270  }
1271  hoc_l_freelist(&psl_);
1272  }
1273  if (pst_) {
1274  delete pst_;
1275  }
1276  delete fixed_play_;
1277  delete fixed_record_;
1278  while(prl_->count()) {
1279  delete prl_->item(prl_->count()-1);
1280  }
1281  delete prl_;
1282  unused_presyn = nil;
1283  delete wl_list_;
1284  delete allthread_hocevents_;
1285 }
1286 
1287 bool NetCvode::localstep(){
1288  return !single_;
1289 }
1290 
1291 bool NetCvode::is_local() { return (cvode_active_ && localstep()); }
1292 
1293 void NetCvode::localstep(bool b) {
1294  // due to possibility of gap junctions and until the complete matrix
1295  // is analysed for block structure localstep and daspk are incompatible
1296  b = (nrn_modeltype() == 1 ? b : false); // localstep doesn't work yet with DAE's
1297 
1298  if (!b != single_) {
1299  delete_list();
1300  single_ = !b;
1301  structure_change_cnt_ = 0;
1302  use_sparse13 = 0;
1303  nrn_use_daspk_ = false;
1304  re_init(nt_t);
1305  }
1306 }
1307 
1308 bool NetCvode::use_daspk(){
1309  return (gcv_ != 0) ? gcv_->use_daspk_ : false;
1310 }
1311 
1312 void NetCvode::use_daspk(bool b) {
1313  b = (nrn_modeltype() == 2 ? true : b); // not optional if algebraic
1314  if (gcv_ && b != gcv_->use_daspk_) {
1315  delete_list();
1316  single_ = (b ? true : single_);
1317  structure_change_cnt_ = 0;
1318  nrn_use_daspk_ = b;
1319 //printf("NetCvode::use_daspk nrn_use_daspk=%d\n", nrn_use_daspk_);
1320  if (use_sparse13 != nrn_use_daspk_) {
1321  use_sparse13 = nrn_use_daspk_;
1322  diam_changed = 1;
1323  }
1324  re_init(nt_t);
1325  }
1326 }
1327 
1328 BAMechList::BAMechList(BAMechList** first) { // preserve the list order
1329  next = nil;
1330  BAMechList* last;
1331  if (*first) {
1332  for (last = *first; last->next; last = last->next){}
1333  last->next = this;
1334  }else{
1335  *first = this;
1336  }
1337 }
1338 
1339 void BAMechList::destruct(BAMechList** first) {
1340  BAMechList* b, *bn;
1341  for (b = *first; b; b = bn) {
1342  bn = b->next;
1343  delete b;
1344  }
1345  *first = nil;
1346 }
1347 
1348 CvodeThreadData::CvodeThreadData() {
1349  no_cap_count_ = 0;
1350  no_cap_child_count_ = 0;
1351  no_cap_node_ = nil;
1352  no_cap_child_ = nil;
1353  cv_memb_list_ = nil;
1354  cmlcap_ = nil;
1355  cmlext_ = nil;
1356  no_cap_memb_ = nil;
1357  before_breakpoint_ = nil;
1358  after_solve_ = nil;
1359  before_step_ = nil;
1360  rootnodecount_ = 0;
1361  v_node_count_ = 0;
1362  v_node_ = nil;
1363  v_parent_ = nil;
1364  psl_th_ = nil;
1365  watch_list_ = nil;
1366  ste_list_ = nil;
1367  pv_ = nil;
1368  pvdot_ = nil;
1369  nvoffset_ = 0;
1370  nvsize_ = 0;
1371  neq_v_ = nonvint_offset_ = 0;
1372  nonvint_extra_offset_ = 0;
1373  record_ = nil;
1374  play_ = nil;
1375 }
1376 CvodeThreadData::~CvodeThreadData() {
1377  if (no_cap_memb_) {
1378  delete_memb_list(no_cap_memb_);
1379  }
1380  if (pv_) {
1381  delete [] pv_;
1382  delete [] pvdot_;
1383  }
1384  if (no_cap_node_) {
1385  delete [] no_cap_node_;
1386  delete [] no_cap_child_;
1387  }
1388  if (watch_list_) {
1389  watch_list_->RemoveAll();
1390  delete watch_list_;
1391  }
1392 }
1393 
1394 void NetCvode::delete_list() {
1395  int i, j;
1396  wl_list_->remove_all();
1397  if (gcv_) {
1398  delete_list(gcv_);
1399  delete gcv_;
1400  gcv_ = nil;
1401  }
1402  for (i = 0; i < pcnt_; ++i) {
1403  NetCvodeThreadData& d = p[i];
1404  if (d.lcv_) {
1405  for (j = 0; j < d.nlcv_; ++j) {
1406  delete_list(d.lcv_ + j);
1407  }
1408  delete [] d.lcv_;
1409  d.lcv_ = nil;
1410  d.nlcv_ = 0;
1411  }
1412  if (d.tq_) {
1413  delete d.tq_;
1414  d.tq_ = nil;
1415  }
1416  }
1417  empty_ = true;
1418 }
1419 
1420 void NetCvode::delete_list(Cvode* cvode) {
1421  del_cv_memb_list(cvode);
1422  Cvode& cv = *cvode;
1423  cv.delete_prl();
1424  delete [] cv.ctd_;
1425  cv.ctd_ = nil;
1426 }
1427 
1428 void NetCvode::del_cv_memb_list() {
1429  if (gcv_) { del_cv_memb_list(gcv_); }
1430  for (int i = 0; i < pcnt_; ++i) {
1431  NetCvodeThreadData& d = p[i];
1432  for (int j = 0; j < d.nlcv_; ++j) {
1433  del_cv_memb_list(d.lcv_ + j);
1434  }
1435  }
1436 }
1437 void NetCvode::del_cv_memb_list(Cvode* cvode) {
1438  int i, j;
1439  if (!cvode) { return; }
1440  Cvode& cv = *cvode;
1441  for (j=0; j < cv.nctd_; ++j) {
1442  CvodeThreadData& z = cv.ctd_[j];
1443  if (z.psl_th_) {
1444  z.psl_th_->remove_all();
1445  delete z.psl_th_;
1446  z.psl_th_ = nil;
1447  }
1448  if (cvode != gcv_) {
1449  if (z.v_node_) {
1450  delete [] z.v_node_;
1451  delete [] z.v_parent_;
1452  z.v_node_ = nil;
1453  z.v_parent_ = nil;
1454  }
1455  z.delete_memb_list(z.cv_memb_list_);
1456  }else{
1457  CvMembList* cml, *cmlnext;
1458  for (cml = z.cv_memb_list_; cml; cml = cmlnext) {
1459  cmlnext = cml->next;
1460  delete cml;
1461  }
1462  }
1463  z.cv_memb_list_ = nil;
1464  BAMechList::destruct(&z.before_breakpoint_);
1465  BAMechList::destruct(&z.after_solve_);
1466  BAMechList::destruct(&z.before_step_);
1467  }
1468 }
1469 
1470 CvMembList::CvMembList() {
1471  index = -1;
1472  ml = new Memb_list;
1473 }
1474 CvMembList::~CvMembList() {
1475  delete ml;
1476 }
1477 
1478 void CvodeThreadData::delete_memb_list(CvMembList* cmlist) {
1479  CvMembList* cml, *cmlnext;
1480  for (cml = cmlist; cml; cml = cmlnext) {
1481  Memb_list* ml = cml->ml;
1482  cmlnext = cml->next;
1483  delete [] ml->nodelist;
1484 #if CACHEVEC
1485  if (ml->nodeindices) {
1486  delete [] ml->nodeindices;
1487  }
1488 #endif
1489  if (memb_func[cml->index].hoc_mech) {
1490  delete [] ml->prop;
1491  }else{
1492  delete [] ml->data;
1493  delete [] ml->pdata;
1494  }
1495  delete cml;
1496  }
1497 }
1498 
1499 void NetCvode::distribute_dinfo(int* cellnum, int tid) {
1500  int i, j;
1501 //printf("distribute_dinfo %d\n", pst_cnt_);
1502  if (psl_) {
1503  hoc_Item* q;
1504  ITERATE(q, psl_) {
1505  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
1506 //printf("\tPreSyn %s\n", ps->osrc_ ? hoc_object_name(ps->osrc_):secname(ps->ssrc_));
1507  if (ps->thvar_) { // artcells and presyns for gid's not on this cpu have no threshold check
1508  NrnThread* nt;
1509  Cvode* cvsrc;
1510  CvodeThreadData* z;
1511  // cvode instances poll which presyns
1512  if (single_) {
1513  if (ps->osrc_) {
1514  nt = (NrnThread*)ob2pntproc(ps->osrc_)->_vnt;
1515  }else if (ps->ssrc_) {
1516  nt = ps->ssrc_->pnode[0]->_nt;
1517  }else{
1518  nt = nrn_threads;
1519  }
1520  cvsrc = gcv_;
1521  z = cvsrc->ctd_ + nt->id;
1522  if (!z->psl_th_) {
1523  z->psl_th_ = new PreSynList(pst_cnt_);
1524  }
1525  z->psl_th_->append(ps);
1526  }else{
1527 
1528  if (ps->osrc_) {
1529  j = node(ps->osrc_)->v_node_index;
1530  nt = (NrnThread*)ob2pntproc(ps->osrc_)->_vnt;
1531  }else if (ps->ssrc_) {
1532  j = ps->ssrc_->pnode[0]->v_node_index;
1533  nt = ps->ssrc_->pnode[0]->_nt;
1534  }else{
1535  j = 0;
1536  nt = nrn_threads;
1537  }
1538  if (tid == nt->id) {
1539  cvsrc = p[tid].lcv_ + cellnum[j];
1540  z = cvsrc->ctd_;
1541  if (nt == cvsrc->nth_) {
1542  if (!z->psl_th_) {
1543  z->psl_th_ = new PreSynList(1);
1544  }
1545  z->psl_th_->append(ps);
1546  }
1547  }
1548  }
1549  }
1550  }
1551  }
1552 }
1553 
1554 void NetCvode::alloc_list() {
1555  int i;
1556  set_CVRhsFn();
1557  if (single_) {
1558  gcv_ = new Cvode();
1559  Cvode& cv = *gcv_;
1560  cv.ncv_ = this;
1561  cv.nctd_ = nrn_nthread;
1562  cv.ctd_ = new CvodeThreadData[cv.nctd_];
1563  }else{
1564  for (int id=0; id < nrn_nthread; ++id) {
1565  NrnThread& nt = nrn_threads[id];
1566  NetCvodeThreadData& d = p[id];
1567  d.nlcv_ = nt.ncell;
1568  d.lcv_ = new Cvode[d.nlcv_];
1569  d.tq_ = new TQueue(d.tpool_);
1570  for (i=0; i < d.nlcv_; ++i) {
1571  TQItem* ti = d.tq_->insert(0., d.lcv_+i);
1572  d.lcv_[i].tqitem_ = ti;
1573  Cvode& cv = d.lcv_[i];
1574  cv.nth_ = &nt;
1575  cv.ncv_ = this;
1576  cv.nctd_ = 1;
1577  cv.ctd_ = new CvodeThreadData[cv.nctd_];
1578  }
1579  }
1580  }
1581  empty_ = false;
1582 #if USENEOSIM
1583  if (p_nrn2neosim_send) for (i=0; i < nlist_; ++i) {
1584  p.lcv_[i].neosim_self_events_ = new TQueue();
1585  }
1586 #endif
1587 }
1588 
1589 bool NetCvode::init_global() {
1590  int i;
1591  CvMembList* cml;
1592  if (tree_changed) { setup_topology(); }
1593  if (v_structure_change) { v_setup_vectors(); }
1594  if (structure_change_cnt_ == structure_change_cnt) {
1595  return false;
1596  }
1597  if (diam_changed) { // need to guarantee that the matrix is allocated
1598  recalc_diam(); // for the present method
1599  }
1600  structure_change_cnt_ = structure_change_cnt;
1601  matrix_change_cnt_ = -1;
1602  playrec_change_cnt_ = 0;
1603  if (hdp_) {
1604  delete hdp_;
1605  hdp_ = nil;
1606  }
1607  NrnThread* _nt;
1608  if (single_) {
1609  if (!gcv_ || gcv_->nctd_ != nrn_nthread) {
1610  delete_list();
1611  alloc_list();
1612  }
1613  del_cv_memb_list();
1614  Cvode& cv = *gcv_;
1615  distribute_dinfo(nil, 0);
1616  FOR_THREADS(_nt) {
1617  CvodeThreadData& z = cv.ctd_[_nt->id];
1618  z.rootnodecount_ = _nt->ncell;
1619  z.v_node_count_ = _nt->end;
1620  z.v_node_ = _nt->_v_node;
1621  z.v_parent_ = _nt->_v_parent;
1622 
1623  CvMembList* last = 0;
1624  for (NrnThreadMembList* tml = _nt->tml; tml; tml = tml->next) {
1625  i = tml->index;
1626  Memb_func* mf = memb_func + i;
1627  Memb_list* ml = tml->ml;
1628  if (ml->nodecount
1629  && (i == CAP
1630  || mf->current || mf->ode_count || mf->ode_matsol
1631  || mf->ode_spec || mf->state )
1632  ) {
1633  // maintain same order (not reversed) for
1634  // singly linked list built below
1635  cml = new CvMembList;
1636  if (!z.cv_memb_list_) {
1637  z.cv_memb_list_ = cml;
1638  }else{
1639  last->next = cml;
1640  }
1641  last = cml;
1642  cml->next = nil;
1643  cml->index = i;
1644  cml->ml->nodecount = ml->nodecount;
1645  // assumes cell info grouped contiguously
1646  cml->ml->nodelist = ml->nodelist;
1647 #if CACHEVEC
1648  cml->ml->nodeindices = ml->nodeindices;
1649 #endif
1650  if (mf->hoc_mech) {
1651  cml->ml->prop = ml->prop;
1652  }else{
1653  cml->ml->data = ml->data;
1654  cml->ml->pdata = ml->pdata;
1655  }
1656  cml->ml->_thread = ml->_thread;
1657  }
1658  }
1659  fill_global_ba(_nt, BEFORE_BREAKPOINT, &z.before_breakpoint_);
1660  fill_global_ba(_nt, AFTER_SOLVE, &z.after_solve_);
1661  fill_global_ba(_nt, BEFORE_STEP, &z.before_step_);
1662  // Every point process, but not artificial cells, cause at least a retreat.
1663  // All point processes, but not artificial cells,
1664  // have the global cvode as its nvi field
1665  for (NrnThreadMembList* tml = _nt->tml; tml; tml = tml->next) {
1666  i = tml->index;
1667  Memb_func* mf = memb_func + i;
1668  if (mf->is_point && !nrn_is_artificial_[i]) {
1669  Memb_list* ml = tml->ml;
1670  int j;
1671  for (j = 0; j < ml->nodecount; ++j) {
1672  Point_process* pp;
1673  if (mf->hoc_mech) {
1674  pp = (Point_process*)ml->prop[j]->dparam[1]._pvoid;
1675  }else{
1676  pp = (Point_process*)ml->pdata[j][1]._pvoid;
1677  }
1678  pp->nvi_ = gcv_;
1679  }
1680  }
1681  }
1682  }
1683  }else{ // lvardt
1684  bool b = false;
1685  if (gcv_) { b = true; }
1686  if (!b) for (i=0; i < pcnt_; ++i) {
1687  if (p[i].nlcv_ != nrn_threads[i].ncell) {
1688  b = true;
1689  }
1690  }
1691  if(b) {
1692  delete_list();
1693  alloc_list();
1694  }
1695  del_cv_memb_list();
1696  // each node has a cell number
1697  for (int id = 0; id < nrn_nthread; ++id) {
1698  NrnThread* _nt = nrn_threads + id;
1699  NetCvodeThreadData& d = p[id];
1700  if (_nt->end == 0) { continue; }
1701  int* cellnum = new int[_nt->end];
1702  for (i=0; i < _nt->ncell; ++i) {
1703  cellnum[i] = i;
1704  }
1705  for (i=_nt->ncell; i < _nt->end; ++i) {
1706  cellnum[i] = cellnum[_nt->_v_parent[i]->v_node_index];
1707  }
1708 
1709  for (i=0; i < _nt->ncell; ++i) {
1710  d.lcv_[i].ctd_[0].v_node_count_ = 0;
1711  }
1712  for (i=0; i < _nt->end; ++i) {
1713  ++d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_count_;
1714  }
1715  for (i=0; i < _nt->ncell; ++i) {
1716  d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_ = new Node*[d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_count_];
1717  d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_parent_ = new Node*[d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_count_];
1718  }
1719  for (i=0; i < _nt->ncell; ++i) {
1720  d.lcv_[i].ctd_[0].v_node_count_ = 0;
1721  d.lcv_[i].ctd_[0].rootnodecount_ = 1;
1722  }
1723  for (i=0; i < _nt->end; ++i) {
1724  d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_[d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_count_] = _nt->_v_node[i];
1725  d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_parent_[d.lcv_[cellnum[i]].ctd_[0].v_node_count_++] = _nt->_v_parent[i];
1726  }
1727  // divide the memb_list info into per cell info
1728  // count
1729  CvMembList** last = new CvMembList*[_nt->ncell];
1730  for (NrnThreadMembList* tml = _nt->tml; tml; tml = tml->next) {
1731  i = tml->index;
1732  Memb_func* mf = memb_func + i;
1733  Memb_list* ml = tml->ml;
1734  if (ml->nodecount
1735  && (mf->current || mf->ode_count || mf->ode_matsol
1736  || mf->ode_spec || mf->state || i == CAP)
1737  ) {
1738  // maintain same order (not reversed) for
1739  // singly linked list built below
1740  int j;
1741  for (j = 0; j < ml->nodecount; ++j) {
1742  int inode = ml->nodelist[j]->v_node_index;
1743  Cvode& cv = d.lcv_[cellnum[inode]];
1744  CvodeThreadData& z = cv.ctd_[0];
1745  if (!z.cv_memb_list_) {
1746  cml = new CvMembList;
1747  cml->next = nil;
1748  cml->index = i;
1749  cml->ml->nodecount = 0;
1750  z.cv_memb_list_ = cml;
1751  last[cellnum[inode]] = cml;
1752  }
1753  if (last[cellnum[inode]]->index == i) {
1754  ++last[cellnum[inode]]->ml->nodecount;
1755  }else{
1756  cml = new CvMembList;
1757  last[cellnum[inode]]->next = cml;
1758  cml->next = nil;
1759  last[cellnum[inode]] = cml;
1760  cml->index = i;
1761  cml->ml->nodecount = 1;
1762  }
1763  }
1764  }
1765  }
1766  delete [] last;
1767  // allocate and re-initialize count
1768  CvMembList** cvml = new CvMembList*[d.nlcv_];
1769  for (i=0; i < d.nlcv_; ++i) {
1770  cvml[i] = d.lcv_[i].ctd_[0].cv_memb_list_;
1771  for (cml = cvml[i]; cml; cml = cml->next) {
1772  Memb_list* ml = cml->ml;
1773  ml->nodelist = new Node*[ml->nodecount];
1774 #if CACHEVEC
1775  ml->nodeindices = new int[ml->nodecount];
1776 #endif
1777  if (memb_func[cml->index].hoc_mech) {
1778  ml->prop = new Prop*[ml->nodecount];
1779  }else{
1780  ml->data = new double*[ml->nodecount];
1781  ml->pdata = new Datum*[ml->nodecount];
1782  }
1783  ml->nodecount = 0;
1784  }
1785  }
1786  // fill pointers (and nodecount)
1787  // now list order is from 0 to n_memb_func
1788  for (NrnThreadMembList* tml = _nt->tml; tml; tml = tml->next) {
1789  i = tml->index;
1790  Memb_func* mf = memb_func + i;
1791  Memb_list* ml = tml->ml;
1792  if (ml->nodecount
1793  && (mf->current || mf->ode_count || mf->ode_matsol
1794  || mf->ode_spec || mf->state || i == CAP)
1795  ) {
1796  int j;
1797  for (j = 0; j < ml->nodecount; ++j) {
1798  int icell = cellnum[ml->nodelist[j]->v_node_index];
1799  Cvode& cv = d.lcv_[icell];
1800  CvodeThreadData& z = cv.ctd_[0];
1801  if (cvml[icell]->index != i) {
1802  cvml[icell] = cvml[icell]->next;
1803  assert (cvml[icell] && cvml[icell]->index);
1804  }
1805  cml = cvml[icell];
1806  cml->ml->nodelist[cml->ml->nodecount] = ml->nodelist[j];
1807 #if CACHEVEC
1808  cml->ml->nodeindices[cml->ml->nodecount] = ml->nodeindices[j];
1809 #endif
1810  if (mf->hoc_mech) {
1811  cml->ml->prop[cml->ml->nodecount] = ml->prop[j];
1812  }else{
1813  cml->ml->data[cml->ml->nodecount] = ml->data[j];
1814  cml->ml->pdata[cml->ml->nodecount] = ml->pdata[j];
1815  }
1816  cml->ml->_thread = ml->_thread;
1817  ++cml->ml->nodecount;
1818  }
1819  }
1820  }
1821  // do the above for the BEFORE/AFTER functions
1822  fill_local_ba(cellnum, d);
1823 
1824  distribute_dinfo(cellnum, id);
1825  // If a point process is not an artificial cell, fill its nvi_ field.
1826  // artifical cells have no integrator
1827  for (NrnThreadMembList* tml = _nt->tml; tml; tml = tml->next) {
1828  i = tml->index;
1829  Memb_func* mf = memb_func + i;
1830  if (mf->is_point) {
1831  Memb_list* ml = tml->ml;
1832  int j;
1833  for (j = 0; j < ml->nodecount; ++j) {
1834  Point_process* pp;
1835  if (mf->hoc_mech) {
1836  pp = (Point_process*)ml->prop[j]->dparam[1]._pvoid;
1837  }else{
1838  pp = (Point_process*)ml->pdata[j][1]._pvoid;
1839  }
1840  if (nrn_is_artificial_[i] == 0) {
1841  int inode = ml->nodelist[j]->v_node_index;
1842  pp->nvi_ = d.lcv_ + cellnum[inode];
1843  }else{
1844  pp->nvi_ = nil;
1845  }
1846  }
1847  }
1848  }
1849  delete [] cellnum;
1850  delete [] cvml;
1851  }
1852  }
1853  return true;
1854 }
1855 
1856 void NetCvode::fill_global_ba(NrnThread* nt, int bat, BAMechList** baml) {
1857  NrnThreadBAList* tbl;
1858  for (tbl = nt->tbl[bat]; tbl; tbl = tbl->next) {
1859  BAMechList* ba = new BAMechList(baml);
1860  ba->bam = tbl->bam;
1861  ba->ml = tbl->ml;
1862  }
1863 }
1864 
1865 void NetCvode::fill_local_ba(int* celnum, NetCvodeThreadData& d) {
1866  fill_local_ba_cnt(BEFORE_BREAKPOINT, celnum, d);
1867  fill_local_ba_cnt(AFTER_SOLVE, celnum, d);
1868  fill_local_ba_cnt(BEFORE_STEP, celnum, d);
1869 }
1870 
1871 void NetCvode::fill_local_ba_cnt(int bat, int* celnum, NetCvodeThreadData& d) {
1872  BAMech* bam;
1873  for (bam = bamech_[bat]; bam; bam = bam->next) {
1874  for (int icv = 0; icv < d.nlcv_; ++icv) {
1875  Cvode* cv = d.lcv_ + icv;
1876  assert(cv->nctd_ == 1);
1877  for (CvMembList* cml = cv->ctd_[0].cv_memb_list_; cml; cml = cml->next) {
1878  if (cml->index == bam->type) {
1879  Memb_list* ml = cml->ml;
1880  BAMechList* bl = cvbml(bat, bam, cv);
1881  bl->bam = bam;
1882  bl->ml = ml;
1883  }
1884  }
1885  }
1886  }
1887 }
1888 
1889 BAMechList* NetCvode::cvbml(int bat, BAMech* bam, Cvode* cv) {
1890  BAMechList** pbml;
1891  BAMechList* ba;
1892  if (bat == BEFORE_BREAKPOINT) {
1893  pbml = &cv->ctd_->before_breakpoint_;
1894  }else if (bat == AFTER_SOLVE) {
1895  pbml = &cv->ctd_->after_solve_;
1896  }else{
1897  pbml = &cv->ctd_->before_step_;
1898  }
1899  if (!*pbml) {
1900  ba = new BAMechList(pbml);
1901  }else{
1902  for (ba = *pbml; ba; ba = ba->next) {
1903  if (ba->bam->type == bam->type) {
1904  return ba;
1905  }
1906  }
1907  ba = new BAMechList(pbml);
1908  }
1909  ba->bam = bam;
1910  return ba;
1911 }
1912 
1913 /*
1914 The path through NetCvode::solve path is determined by the case dimensions of
1915 (single step, integrate to tout) and (no model, global dt, localdt).
1916 For threads there is one more constraint--- do not allow t0_ to pass
1917 by the minimum interthread netcon delay integration interval barrier
1918 without making sure all the interthread events to be delivered before
1919 that barrier are on the thread queue. For classical mpi spike exchange
1920 this was ensured by a NetParEvent which provided a synchronization barrier.
1921 We generalized this to a NetParEvent per thread and a thread barrier but
1922 there was a consequent loss of the possibility of sequential threads since
1923 in that context a barrier makes no sense (each job must run to completion).
1924 Hence the desire to avoid barriers and handle the interval barrier explicity
1925 here to make sure NetCvode::enqueue is called frequently enough.
1926 (Actually, it is called very frequently since it is called by deliver_events,
1927 so it is only required that the interval between the least and greatest
1928 integrator t0_ be less than the maximum).
1929 
1930 Without a thread barrier in NetParEvent,
1931 this mostly affects the "integrate to tout" case. But it also affects
1932 the single step case in that we are not allowed to handle any
1933 events with delivery time > barrier time. Since a microstep does the
1934 earliest next thing, we need to check that before the call.
1935 
1936 Can we deal with multisplit conveniently without a thread barrier.
1937 Yes if we split up the process into its three phases of triangularization,
1938 reduced tree solve, back substitution. No if we retain a single
1939 integration step quantum for the thread.
1940 Without barriers, we end up with finer and finer grain nrn_multithread_job.
1941 
1942 It is sounding more and more reasonable to sacrifice the debugging convenience
1943 of sequential threads in favor of allowing thread barriers.
1944 ...but... a look at the nrn_fixed_step and nrn_multisplit_solve shows
1945 that it would certainly be easy to split into the proper
1946 nrn_multithread_job groups since it is already functionally decomposed
1947 in that way. And we may want to limit NetParEvent to serve only as
1948 interprocessor spike exchange signals for the main thread.
1949 ...but... a look at cvode in a multisplit context
1950 means there must be one global cvode instance
1951 and when f and jacob is called it would divide there and do the scatter
1952 gather etc. Of course, with separate cvode instances with multisplit we
1953 still have to have a proper Vector library which does the corresponding
1954 mpi reduce functions. Conceptually much simpler with barrier and maybe
1955 impossible without. If we went with one global cvode it would be
1956 possible. And cvode overhead seems independent of number of equations
1957 so confining it to the main thread may not be bad.
1958 
1959 The principle multithread domain we design for below is the few event,
1960 multisplit case. That is, there is one cvode instance managed by thread 0
1961 and all events go onto one queue. However, an event is delivered according
1962 to its proper delivery thread. Note that the possiblity of 0 delay
1963 events is allowed. There is nothing that can be done at the minimum
1964 delay integration interval level since each step divides into a dozen or so
1965 multithread jobs.
1966 
1967 Threads and lvardt.
1968 Consider the global cv (used to be p.lcv_[0]) as gcv_ which has ctd[nrn_nthread]
1969 instances of separate CvodeThreadData and works with multisplit.
1970 Now consider the lvardt method (used to be supported by p.lcv_[i]) as
1971 NetCvodeThreadData instances of lcv_[i] and of course move tq_ into
1972 the NetCvodeThreadData. Then each of the p.lcv_[i] would have Cvode.nctd_
1973 equal 1 in which p.lcv_[i].ctd_[0] is the proper CvodeThreadData. Then
1974 Cvode would never look at nrn_nthread to determine the CvodeThreadData
1975 but only the Cvode.nctd_. And if Cvode.nctd_ > 1 which would be
1976 possible only for gcv_, only then would nt->id be used to get the proper
1977 CvodeThreadData. We presume for now that if lvardt is used with nrn_nthread > 1
1978 then the usual minimum delay interval requirements hold for interthread
1979 events.
1980 
1981 Inter-Thread-Events (possibility of 0 delay).
1982 
1983 The fixed step method is that for each step, the sequence of actions
1984 for each thread is:
1985 1) at time tbegin: check thresholds, if source and target on same thread
1986  put directly onto queue. If different threads (PreSyn only), do an
1987  interthread send which puts the event into the target thread
1988  inter_thread_events list. Finally we deliver all events up to tbegin+.5dt,
1989  this first transfers all the threads inter-thread-events onto the queue.
1990 2) at time tbegin + .5dt: v(tbegin) -> v(tend)
1991 3) at time tend: integrate states one step using v(tend)
1992 4) deliver events up to but not past tend (first transfers inter-thread-events
1993  onto queue).
1994 Therefore, a zero-delay inter-thread-event from an artificial cell
1995 generated in step 4 may or may not be delivered
1996 in the time step it is generated. And zero-delay threshold detection interthread
1997 events will be delivered in the time step but either in step 1 or step 4 (ie.
1998 beginning or end of the time step). For this reason, if there are zero-delay
1999 NetCon, then both the source and target should be on the same thread. In practice
2000 we should force them onto thread 0 or at least the source onto the
2001 target thread.
2002 
2003 What about cvode?
2004 Global variable time step method.
2005 As mentioned above, all events, when global cvode active, go onto the thread 0 event
2006 queue (interthread via the thread 0 inter_thread_events list)
2007 and from there are delivered in the context of the proper thread
2008 for cache efficiency (by means of nrn_onethread_job.) Again, as mentioned,
2009 the design side is for few events. With this in mind, there does not seem
2010 any impediment to 0 delay events. But note that an event with source and
2011 target on thread 2 (e.g. a self event) goes onto the thread 0 inter_thread_events
2012 list (in the context of thread 2), then in the context of thread 0 is transferred
2013 from the thread 0 inter_thread_events list to the thread 0 queue, then
2014 in the context of thread 0, the event is taken off the queue and delivered
2015 in the context of thread 2 (by means of nrn_onethread_job). (See why we
2016 are thinking few events? A bothersome aspect is that after every event
2017 delivery least_t has to enqueue onto the thread 0 queue the nthread
2018 inter_thread_events lists.
2019 The one queue idea for global variable time step is unsound because of the
2020 problem that multiple threads call the queue methods and so cause excessive
2021 cache line sharing. And if we avoided this through the use of the
2022 inter_thread_events list then consider a 0 delay NetCon
2023 event between artificial cells on thread 2 and thread 3.
2024 thread 0 in deliver_events_when_threads, least event for thread 2
2025 thread 2 (NET_RECEIVE -> net_send -> PreSyn::send -> p[3].interthead_send
2026 thread 0 enqueue onto thread 0 queue all inter_thread_events lists
2027 thread 0 least event for thread 3
2028 thread 3 (NET_RECEIVE ...)
2029 Actually, there are real problems. E.g ConditionEvent::condition is
2030 in the context of some thread and must remove an event on the thread 0 queue.
2031 That is a recipe for horrendous cacheline sharing and is the whole reason
2032 we designed inter_thread_events in the first place. Also the call to
2033 enqueue_thread0() is multiplying alarmingly (every call before least_t())
2034 and the reason for the privileged thread 0 queue has more or less disappeared.
2035 Instead we only need an effective reduce to find the minimum of the least_t()
2036 in each thread. Expensive but no more expensive than the single queue and without
2037 the cache-line shareing. And allows 0 delay events. And keeps a kind of uniformity
2038 between fixed step, global cvode, and the future lvardt in that each thread
2039 has its own event queue.
2040 Far reaching Local variable time step method change.
2041 gcv_ if it exists, refers to the global variable time step method
2042 and there are nthread CvodeThreadData instances in ctd_. If gcv_ is 0 and
2043 !empty_, then each NetCvodeThreadData manages an array of nlcv_
2044 Cvode instances in the lcv_ array. Each Cvode instance has only one ctd_
2045 Thus for global step the CvodeThreadData for a thread is gcv_->ctd_[i] whereas
2046 for lvardt it is p[i].lcv_[jcell_in_thread_i].ctd_[0].
2047 */
2048 
2049 int NetCvode::solve(double tout) {
2050  if (nrn_nthread > 1) {
2051  return solve_when_threads(tout); // more or less a copy of below
2052  }
2053  NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads;
2054  int err = NVI_SUCCESS;
2055  if (empty_) {
2056  if (tout >= 0.) {
2057  while (p[0].tqe_->least_t() <= tout && stoprun==0) {
2058  deliver_least_event(nt);
2059  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2060  }
2061  if (stoprun==0) { nt_t = tout; }
2062  } else {
2063  if (p[0].tqe_->least()) {
2064  nt_t = p[0].tqe_->least_t();
2065  deliver_events(p[0].tqe_->least_t(), nt);
2066  }else{
2067  nt_t += 1e6;
2068  }
2069  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2070  }
2071  }else if (single_) {
2072  if (tout >= 0.) {
2073  while (gcv_->t_ < tout || p[0].tqe_->least_t() < tout) {
2074  err = global_microstep();
2075  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2076  if (err != NVI_SUCCESS || stoprun) { return err; }
2077  }
2078  retreat(tout, gcv_);
2079  gcv_->record_continuous();
2080  } else {
2081  // advance or initialized
2082  double tc = gcv_->t_;
2083  initialized_ = false;
2084  while (gcv_->t_ <= tc && !initialized_) {
2085  err = global_microstep();
2086  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2087  if (err != NVI_SUCCESS || stoprun) { return err; }
2088  }
2089  }
2090  }else if (!gcv_) { // lvardt
2091  if (tout >= 0.) {
2092  time_t rt = time(nil);
2093 // int cnt = 0;
2094  TQueue* tq = p[0].tq_;
2095  TQueue* tqe = p[0].tqe_;
2096  NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads;
2097  while (tq->least_t() < tout || tqe->least_t() <= tout) {
2098  err = local_microstep(nt);
2099  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2100  if (err != NVI_SUCCESS || stoprun) { return err; }
2101 #if HAVE_IV
2102 IFGUI
2103  if (rt < time(nil)) {
2104 // if (++cnt > 10000) {
2105 // cnt = 0;
2106  Oc oc; oc.notify();
2107  single_event_run();
2108  rt = time(nil);
2109  }
2110 ENDGUI
2111 #endif
2112  }
2113  int n = p[0].nlcv_;
2114  Cvode* lcv = p[0].lcv_;
2115  for (int i=0; i < n; ++i) {
2116  local_retreat(tout, lcv + i);
2117  lcv[i].record_continuous();
2118  }
2119  } else {
2120  // an fadvance is not every microstep but
2121  // only when all the discontinuities at te take place or
2122  // tc increases.
2123  TQueue* tq = p[0].tq_;
2124  double tc = tq->least_t();
2125  double te = p[0].tqe_->least_t();
2126  while (tq->least_t() <= tc && p[0].tqe_->least_t() <= te){
2127  err = local_microstep(nrn_threads);
2128  if (nrn_allthread_handle) { (*nrn_allthread_handle)(); }
2129  if (err != NVI_SUCCESS || stoprun) { return err; }
2130  }
2131  // But make sure t is not past the least time.
2132  // fadvance and local step do not coexist seamlessly.
2133  nt_t = tq->least_t();
2134  if (te < nt_t) {
2135  nt_t = te;
2136  }
2137  }
2138  }else{
2139  nt_t += 1e9;
2140  }
2141  return err;
2142 }
2143 
2144 void NetCvode::handle_tstop_event(double tt, NrnThread* nt) {
2145 #if 0 // now a HocEvent is used to do this
2146  nt->_stop_stepping = 1;
2147  if (cvode_active_) {
2148  if (gcv_) {
2149  retreat(tt, gcv_);
2150  gcv_->record_continuous();
2151  }else{
2152  int i, n = p[nt->id].nlcv_;
2153  Cvode* lcv = p[nt->id].lcv_;
2154  for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
2155  local_retreat(tt, lcv + i);
2156  lcv[i].record_continuous();
2157  }
2158  }
2159  }
2160 #endif
2161 }
2162 
2163 void NetCvode::deliver_least_event(NrnThread* nt) {
2164  TQItem* q = p[nt->id].tqe_->least();
2165  DiscreteEvent* de = (DiscreteEvent*)q->data_;
2166  double tt = q->t_;
2167  p[nt->id].tqe_->remove(q);
2168 #if PRINT_EVENT
2169  if (print_event_) { de->pr("deliver", tt, this); }
2170 #endif
2171  STATISTICS(deliver_cnt_);
2172  de->deliver(tt, this, nt);
2173 }
2174 
2175 #if BGPDMA > 1
2176 #define RP_COUNT 50
2177 static int rp_count;
2178 #endif
2179 
2180 bool NetCvode::deliver_event(double til, NrnThread* nt) {
2181  TQItem* q;
2182  if ((q = p[nt->id].tqe_->atomic_dq(til)) != 0) {
2183  DiscreteEvent* de = (DiscreteEvent*)q->data_;
2184  double tt = q->t_;
2185  p[nt->id].tqe_->release(q);
2186 #if PRINT_EVENT
2187  if (print_event_) { de->pr("deliver", tt, this); }
2188 #endif
2189  STATISTICS(deliver_cnt_);
2190  de->deliver(tt, this, nt);
2191 #if BGPDMA > 1
2192  if (use_dcmf_record_replay) if (--rp_count < 0) {
2193  nrnbgp_messager_advance();
2194  rp_count = RP_COUNT;
2195  }
2196 #endif
2197  return true;
2198  }else{
2199  return false;
2200  }
2201 }
2202 
2203 int NetCvode::local_microstep(NrnThread* nt) {
2204  int err = NVI_SUCCESS;
2205  int i = nt->id;
2206  if (p[i].tqe_->least_t() <= p[i].tq_->least_t()) {
2207  deliver_least_event(nt);
2208  }else{
2209  TQItem* q = p[i].tq_->least();
2210  Cvode* cv = (Cvode*)q->data_;
2211  err = cv->handle_step(this, 1e100);
2212  p[i].tq_->move_least(cv->t_);
2213  }
2214  return err;
2215 }
2216 
2217 int NetCvode::global_microstep() {
2218  NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads;
2219  int err = NVI_SUCCESS;
2220  double tt = p[0].tqe_->least_t();
2221  double tdiff = tt - gcv_->t_;
2222  if (tdiff <= 0) {
2223  // since events do not internally retreat with the
2224  // global step, we should already be at the event time
2225  // if this is too strict, we could use eps(list_->t_).
2226  assert(tdiff == 0.0 || ( gcv_->tstop_begin_ <= tt && tt <= gcv_->tstop_end_));
2227  deliver_events(tt, nt);
2228  }else{
2229  err = gcv_->handle_step(this, tt);
2230  }
2231  if (p[0].tqe_->least_t() < gcv_->t_) {
2232  gcv_->interpolate(p[0].tqe_->least_t());
2233  }
2234  return err;
2235 }
2236 
2237 int Cvode::handle_step(NetCvode* ns, double te) {
2238  int err = NVI_SUCCESS;
2239  // first order correct condition evaluation goes here
2240  if (ns->condition_order() == 1) {
2241  if (ns->gcv_) {// global step
2242  for (int i=0; i < nctd_; ++i) {
2243  nrn_threads[i]._t = t_; // for global step could be assert
2244  }
2245  check_deliver();
2246  // done if the check puts a 0 delay event on queue
2247  if (nctd_ > 1) {
2248  int tid;
2249  if (ns->allthread_least_t(tid) <= t_) {
2250  return err;
2251  }
2252  }else{
2253  if (ns->p[0].tqe_->least_t() <= t_) {
2254  return err;
2255  }
2256  }
2257  }else{ //lvardt so in a specific thread
2258  // for localstep method t is for a different cvode.fun call
2259  nth_->_t = t_;
2260  check_deliver(nth_);
2261  if (ns->p[nth_->id].tqe_->least_t() <= t_) {
2262  return err;
2263  }
2264  }
2265  }
2266  if (initialize_) {
2267  err = init(t_);
2268  if (ns->gcv_) { ns->initialized_ = true; }
2269  // second order correct condition evaluation goes here
2270  if (ns->condition_order() == 2) {
2271  evaluate_conditions(nth_);
2272  }
2273  }else if (te <= tn_) {
2274  err = interpolate(te);
2275  }else if (t_ < tn_) {
2276  err = interpolate(tn_);
2277  }else{
2278  record_continuous();
2279  err = advance_tn();
2280  // second order correct condition evaluation goes here
2281  if (ns->condition_order() == 2) {
2282  evaluate_conditions(nth_);
2283  }
2284  }
2285  return err;
2286 }
2287 
2288 void net_move(void** v, Point_process* pnt, double tt) {
2289  if (!(*v)) {
2290  hoc_execerror( "No event with flag=1 for net_move in ", hoc_object_name(pnt->ob));
2291  }
2292  TQItem* q = (TQItem*)(*v);
2293 //printf("net_move tt=%g %s *v=%p\n", tt, hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), *v);
2294  if (tt < PP2t(pnt)) {
2295  SelfEvent* se = (SelfEvent*)q->data_;
2296  char buf[100];
2297  sprintf(buf, "net_move tt-nt_t = %g", tt-PP2t(pnt));
2298  se->pr(buf, tt, net_cvode_instance);
2299  assert(0);
2300  hoc_execerror("net_move tt < t", 0);
2301  }
2302  net_cvode_instance->move_event(q, tt, PP2NT(pnt));
2303 }
2304 
2305 void artcell_net_move(void** v, Point_process* pnt, double tt) {
2306  if (nrn_use_selfqueue_) {
2307  if (!(*v)) {
2308  hoc_execerror( "No event with flag=1 for net_move in ", hoc_object_name(pnt->ob));
2309  }
2310  NrnThread* nt = PP2NT(pnt);
2311  NetCvodeThreadData& p = net_cvode_instance->p[nt->id];
2312  TQItem* q = (TQItem*)(*v);
2313 //printf("artcell_net_move t=%g qt_=%g tt=%g %s *v=%p\n", nt->_t, q->t_, tt, hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), *v);
2314  if (tt < nt->_t) {
2315  SelfEvent* se = (SelfEvent*)q->data_;
2316  char buf[100];
2317  sprintf(buf, "artcell_net_move tt-nt_t = %g", tt - nt->_t);
2318  se->pr(buf, tt, net_cvode_instance);
2319  hoc_execerror("net_move tt < t", 0);
2320  }
2321  q->t_ = tt;
2322  if (tt < p.immediate_deliver_) {
2323 //printf("artcell_net_move_ %s immediate %g %g %g\n", hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), PP2t(pnt), tt, p.immediate_deliver_);
2324  SelfEvent* se = (SelfEvent*)q->data_;
2325  se->deliver(tt, net_cvode_instance, nt);
2326  }
2327  }else{
2328  net_move(v, pnt, tt);
2329  }
2330 }
2331 
2332 void NetCvode::move_event(TQItem* q, double tnew, NrnThread* nt) {
2333  int tid = nt->id;
2334  STATISTICS(SelfEvent::selfevent_move_);
2335 #if PRINT_EVENT
2336 if (print_event_) {
2337  SelfEvent* se = (SelfEvent*)q->data_;
2338 Printf("NetCvode::move_event self event target %s t=%g, old=%g new=%g\n", hoc_object_name(se->target_->ob), nt->_t, q->t_, tnew);
2339 }
2340 #endif
2341 #if USENEOSIM
2342  // only self events move
2343  if (neosim_entity_){
2344  assert(0);
2345  //cvode_instance->neosim_self_events_->move(q, tnew);
2346  }else{
2347  p[tid].tqe_->move(q, tnew);
2348  }
2349 #else
2350  p[tid].tqe_->move(q, tnew);
2351 #endif
2352 }
2353 
2354 void NetCvode::remove_event(TQItem* q, int tid) {
2355  p[tid].tqe_->remove(q);
2356 }
2357 
2358 // for threads, revised net_send to use absolute time (in the
2359 // mod file we add the thread time when we call it).
2360 void net_send(void** v, double* weight, Point_process* pnt, double td, double flag) {
2361  STATISTICS(SelfEvent::selfevent_send_);
2362  NrnThread* nt = PP2NT(pnt);
2363  NetCvodeThreadData& p = net_cvode_instance->p[nt->id];
2364  SelfEvent* se = p.sepool_->alloc();
2365  se->flag_ = flag;
2366  se->target_ = pnt;
2367  se->weight_ = weight;
2368  se->movable_ = v; // needed for SaveState
2369  assert(net_cvode_instance);
2370  ++p.unreffed_event_cnt_;
2371  if (td < nt->_t) {
2372  char buf[100];
2373  sprintf(buf, "net_send td-t = %g", td - nt->_t);
2374  se->pr(buf, td, net_cvode_instance);
2375  abort();
2376  hoc_execerror("net_send delay < 0", 0);
2377  }
2378  TQItem* q;
2379 #if USENEOSIM
2380  if (neosim_entity_) {
2381  assert(0);
2382  //cvode_instance->neosim_self_events_->insert(td, se);
2383  }else{
2384  q = net_cvode_instance->event(td, se, nt);
2385  }
2386 #else
2387  q = net_cvode_instance->event(td, se, nt);
2388 #endif
2389  if (flag == 1.0) {
2390  *v = (void*)q;
2391  }
2392 //printf("net_send %g %s %g %p\n", td, hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), flag, *v);
2393 }
2394 
2395 void artcell_net_send(void** v, double* weight, Point_process* pnt, double td, double flag) {
2396  if (nrn_use_selfqueue_ && flag == 1.0) {
2397  STATISTICS(SelfEvent::selfevent_send_);
2398  NrnThread* nt = PP2NT(pnt);
2399  NetCvodeThreadData& p = net_cvode_instance->p[nt->id];
2400  SelfEvent* se = p.sepool_->alloc();
2401  se->flag_ = flag;
2402  se->target_ = pnt;
2403  se->weight_ = weight;
2404  se->movable_ = v; // needed for SaveState
2405  assert(net_cvode_instance);
2406  ++p.unreffed_event_cnt_;
2407  if (td < nt->_t) {
2408  char buf[100];
2409  sprintf(buf, "net_send td-t = %g", td - nt->_t);
2410  se->pr(buf, td, net_cvode_instance);
2411  hoc_execerror("net_send delay < 0", 0);
2412  }
2413  TQItem* q;
2414  q = p.selfqueue_->insert(se);
2415  q->t_ = td;
2416  *v = (void*)q;
2417 //printf("artcell_net_send %g %s %g %p\n", td, hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), flag, v);
2418  if (q->t_ < p.immediate_deliver_) {
2419 //printf("artcell_net_send_ %s immediate %g %g %g\n", hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), nt->_t, q->t_, p.immediate_deliver_);
2420  SelfEvent* se = (SelfEvent*)q->data_;
2421  p.selfqueue_->remove(q);
2422  se->deliver(td, net_cvode_instance, nt);
2423  }
2424  }else{
2425  net_send(v, weight, pnt, td, flag);
2426  }
2427 }
2428 
2429 void net_event(Point_process* pnt, double time) {
2430  STATISTICS(net_event_cnt_);
2431  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)pnt->presyn_;
2432  if (ps) {
2433  if (time < PP2t(pnt)) {
2434  char buf[100];
2435  sprintf(buf, "net_event time-t = %g", time-PP2t(pnt));
2436  ps->pr(buf, time, net_cvode_instance);
2437  hoc_execerror("net_event time < t", 0);
2438  }
2439 #if USENEOSIM
2440  if (neosim_entity_) {
2441  (*p_nrn2neosim_send)(neosim_entity_, nt_t);
2442  }else{
2443 #endif
2444  ps->send(time, net_cvode_instance, ps->nt_);
2445 #if USENEOSIM
2446  }
2447 #endif
2448  }
2449 }
2450 
2451 void _nrn_watch_activate(Datum* d, double (*c)(Point_process*), int i, Point_process* pnt, int r, double flag) {
2452 // printf("_nrn_cond_activate %s flag=%g first return = %g\n", hoc_object_name(pnt->ob), flag, c(pnt));
2453  if (!d->_pvoid) {
2454  d->_pvoid = (void*)new WatchList();
2455  }
2456  if (!d[i]._pvoid) {
2457  d[i]._pvoid = (void*)new WatchCondition(pnt, c);
2458  }
2459  WatchList* wl = (WatchList*)d->_pvoid;
2460  if (r == 0) {
2461  int j;
2462  for (j=0; j < wl->count(); ++j) {
2463  WatchCondition* wc1 = wl->item(j);
2464  wc1->Remove();
2465  if (wc1->qthresh_) { // is it on the queue?
2466  net_cvode_instance->remove_event(wc1->qthresh_, PP2NT(pnt)->id);
2467  wc1->qthresh_ = nil;
2468  }
2469  }
2470  wl->remove_all();
2471  }
2472  WatchCondition* wc = (WatchCondition*)d[i]._pvoid;
2473  wl->append(wc);
2474  wc->activate(flag);
2475 }
2476 
2477 void _nrn_free_watch(Datum* d, int offset, int n) {
2478  int i;
2479  int nn = offset + n;
2480  if (d[offset]._pvoid) {
2481  WatchList* wl = (WatchList*)d[offset]._pvoid;
2482  delete wl;
2483  }
2484  for (i=offset+1; i < nn; ++i) {
2485  if (d[i]._pvoid) {
2486  WatchCondition* wc = (WatchCondition*)d[i]._pvoid;
2487  wc->Remove();
2488  delete wc;
2489  }
2490  }
2491 }
2492 
2493 void NetCvode::vec_event_store() {
2494  // not destroyed when vector destroyed.
2495  // should resize to 0 or remove before storing, just keeps incrementing
2496  if (vec_event_store_) {
2497  vec_event_store_ = nil;
2498  }
2499  if (ifarg(1)) {
2500  vec_event_store_ = vector_arg(1);
2501  }
2502 }
2503 
2504 #if BBTQ == 3 || BBTQ == 4
2505 TQItem* NetCvode::fifo_event(double td, DiscreteEvent* db) {
2506  if (nrn_use_fifo_queue_) {
2507 #if PRINT_EVENT
2508  if (print_event_) { db->pr("send", td, this); }
2509  if (vec_event_store_) {
2510  Vect* x = vec_event_store_;
2511  int n = x->capacity();
2512  x->resize_chunk(n+2);
2513  x->elem(n) = t;
2514  x->elem(n+1) = td;
2515  }
2516 #endif
2517  return p[0].tqe_->insert_fifo(td, db);
2518  }else{
2519  return p[0].tqe_->insert(td, db);
2520  }
2521 }
2522 #else
2523 #define fifo_event event
2524 #endif
2525 
2526 #if BBTQ == 5
2527 TQItem* NetCvode::bin_event(double td, DiscreteEvent* db, NrnThread* nt) {
2528  if (nrn_use_bin_queue_) {
2529 #if PRINT_EVENT
2530  if (print_event_) {db->pr("binq send", td, this);}
2531  if (vec_event_store_) {
2532  assert(0);
2533  Vect* x = vec_event_store_;
2534  int n = x->capacity();
2535  x->resize_chunk(n+2);
2536  x->elem(n) = nt_t;
2537  x->elem(n+1) = td;
2538  }
2539 #endif
2540  return p[nt->id].tqe_->enqueue_bin(td, db);
2541  }else{
2542 #if PRINT_EVENT
2543  if (print_event_) {db->pr("send", td, this);}
2544 #endif
2545  return p[nt->id].tqe_->insert(td, db);
2546  }
2547 }
2548 #else
2549 #define bin_event event
2550 #endif
2551 
2552 TQItem* NetCvode::event(double td, DiscreteEvent* db, NrnThread* nt) {
2553 #if PRINT_EVENT
2554  if (print_event_) { db->pr("send", td, this); }
2555  if (vec_event_store_) {
2556  Vect* x = vec_event_store_;
2557  int n = x->capacity();
2558  x->resize_chunk(n+2);
2559  x->elem(n) = nt_t;
2560  x->elem(n+1) = td;
2561  }
2562 #endif
2563  return p[nt->id].tqe_->insert(td, db);
2564 }
2565 
2566 void NetCvode::null_event(double tt) {
2567  assert(0);
2568  NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads;
2569  if (tt - nt->_t < 0) { return; }
2570 #if USENEOSIM
2571  if (neosim_entity_) {
2572  // ignore for neosim. There is no appropriate cvode_instance
2573  // cvode_instance->neosim_self_events_->insert(nt_t + delay, null_event_);
2574  }else{
2575  event(tt, null_event_, nt);
2576  }
2577 #else
2578  event(tt, null_event_, nt);
2579 #endif
2580 }
2581 
2582 void NetCvode::tstop_event(double tt) {
2583  if (tt - nt_t < 0) { return; }
2584 #if USENEOSIM
2585  if (neosim_entity_) {
2586  // ignore for neosim. There is no appropriate cvode_instance
2587  // cvode_instance->neosim_self_events_->insert(nt_t + delay, tstop_event_);
2588  }else
2589 #endif
2590  {
2591  if (gcv_) {
2592  event(tt, tstop_event_, nrn_threads);
2593  }else{
2594  NrnThread* nt;
2595  FOR_THREADS(nt) {
2596  event(tt, tstop_event_, nt);
2597  }
2598  }
2599  }
2600 }
2601 
2602 void NetCvode::hoc_event(double tt, const char* stmt, Object* ppobj, int reinit, Object* pyact) {
2603  if (!ppobj && tt - nt_t < 0) { return; }
2604 #if USENEOSIM
2605  if (neosim_entity_) {
2606  // ignore for neosim. There is no appropriate cvode_instance
2607  // cvode_instance->neosim_self_events_->insert(nt_t + delay, null_event_);
2608  }else
2609 #endif
2610  {
2611  NrnThread* nt = nrn_threads;
2612  if (nrn_nthread > 1 && (!cvode_active_ || localstep())) {
2613  if (ppobj) {
2614  int i = PP2NT(ob2pntproc(ppobj))->id;
2615  p[i].interthread_send(tt, HocEvent::alloc(stmt, ppobj, reinit, pyact), nt+i);
2616  nrn_interthread_enqueue(nt + i);
2617  }else{
2618  HocEvent* he = HocEvent::alloc(stmt, nil, 0, pyact);
2619  // put on each queue. The first thread to execute the deliver
2620  // for he will set the nrn_allthread_handle
2621  // callback which will cause all threads to rejoin at the
2622  // end of the current fixed step or, for var step methods,
2623  // after all events at this time are delivered. It is up
2624  // to the callers of the multithread_job functions
2625  // to do the right thing.
2626  for (int i=0; i < nrn_nthread; ++i) {
2627  p[i].interthread_send(tt, he, nt + i);
2628  }
2629  nrn_multithread_job(nrn_interthread_enqueue);
2630  }
2631  }else{
2632  event(tt, HocEvent::alloc(stmt, ppobj, reinit, pyact), nt);
2633  }
2634  }
2635 }
2636 
2637 void NetCvode::allthread_handle() {
2638  nrn_allthread_handle = nil;
2639  t = nt_t;
2640  while (allthread_hocevents_->count()) {
2641  HocEvent* he = allthread_hocevents_->item(0);
2642  allthread_hocevents_->remove(0);
2643  he->allthread_handle();
2644  }
2645 }
2646 
2647 void NetCvode::allthread_handle(double tt, HocEvent* he, NrnThread* nt) {
2648  //printf("allthread_handle tt=%g nt=%d nt_t=%g\n", tt, nt->id, nt->_t);
2649  nt->_stop_stepping = 1;
2650  if (is_local()) {
2651  int i, n = p[nt->id].nlcv_;
2652  Cvode* lcv = p[nt->id].lcv_;
2653  if (n) for (i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
2654  local_retreat(tt, lcv + i);
2655  if (!he->stmt()) {
2656  lcv[i].record_continuous();
2657  }
2658  }else{
2659  nt->_t = tt;
2660  }
2661  } else if (!he->stmt() && cvode_active_ && gcv_) {
2662  assert(MyMath::eq2(tt, gcv_->t_, NetCvode::eps(tt)));
2663  gcv_->record_continuous();
2664  }
2665  if (nt->id == 0) {
2666  nrn_allthread_handle = allthread_handle_callback;
2667  allthread_hocevents_->append(he);
2668  nt->_t = tt;
2669  }
2670  if (cvode_active_ && gcv_ && nrnmpi_numprocs > 1) {
2671  assert(nrn_nthread == 1);
2672  return;
2673  }
2674  // deliver any other events at this time (in particular, a possible NetParEvent)
2675  // to guarantee consistency of the NetParEvent for all threads
2676  // Otherwise, if some threads do a NetParEvent and others not, then
2677  // the interthread enqueue can put an earlier event onto the thread queue
2678  // than the last delivered event
2679  deliver_events(tt, nt);
2680 }
2681 
2682 #if 0
2683 struct PPArgs {
2684  int type;
2685  Point_process* pp;
2686  double* w;
2687  double f;
2688 };
2689 
2690 static PPArgs* ppargs;
2691 
2692 static void point_receive_job(NrnThread* nt) {
2693  PPArgs* p = ppargs + nt->id;
2694  (*pnt_receive[p->type])(p->pp, p->w, p->f);
2695 }
2696 
2697 void NetCvode::point_receive(int type, Point_process* pp, double* w, double f) {
2698  // this is the master thread. need to execute the pthread associated
2699  // with the pp.
2700  int id = PP2NT(pp)->id;
2701  if (id == 0) { // execute on this, the master thread
2702  (*pnt_receive[type])(pp, w, f);
2703  }else{
2704  // marshall the args
2705  PPArgs* p = ppargs + id;
2706  p->type = type;
2707  p->pp = pp;
2708  p->w = w;
2709  p->f = f;
2710  nrn_onethread_job(id, point_receive_job);
2711  }
2712  // global queue with different threads putting things in
2713  // means no guarantee that something goes into the queue
2714  // to be delivered earlier than something last extracted.
2715  // so return to calling main thread only after the
2716  // worker thread is done. Too bad...
2717  // this needs to be worked on. Only thread id is executing.
2718  nrn_wait_for_threads();
2719 }
2720 #endif
2721 
2722 void NetCvode::clear_events() {
2723  int i;
2724  deliver_cnt_ = net_event_cnt_ = 0;
2725  NetCon::netcon_send_active_ = 0;
2726  NetCon::netcon_send_inactive_ = 0;
2727  NetCon::netcon_deliver_ = 0;
2728  ConditionEvent::init_above_ = 0;
2729  ConditionEvent::send_qthresh_ = 0;
2730  ConditionEvent::deliver_qthresh_ = 0;
2731  ConditionEvent::abandon_ = 0;
2732  ConditionEvent::eq_abandon_ = 0;
2733  ConditionEvent::abandon_init_above_ = 0;
2734  ConditionEvent::abandon_init_below_ = 0;
2735  ConditionEvent::abandon_above_ = 0;
2736  ConditionEvent::abandon_below_ = 0;
2737  PreSyn::presyn_send_mindelay_ = 0;
2738  PreSyn::presyn_send_direct_ = 0;
2739  PreSyn::presyn_deliver_netcon_ = 0;
2740  PreSyn::presyn_deliver_direct_ = 0;
2741  PreSyn::presyn_deliver_ncsend_ = 0;
2742  SelfEvent::selfevent_send_ = 0;
2743  SelfEvent::selfevent_move_ = 0;
2744  SelfEvent::selfevent_deliver_ = 0;
2745  WatchCondition::watch_send_ = 0;
2746  WatchCondition::watch_deliver_ = 0;
2747  PlayRecordEvent::playrecord_deliver_ = 0;
2748  PlayRecordEvent::playrecord_send_ = 0;
2749  HocEvent::hocevent_send_ = 0;
2750  HocEvent::hocevent_deliver_ = 0;
2751  DiscreteEvent::discretevent_send_ = 0;
2752  DiscreteEvent::discretevent_deliver_ = 0;
2753  KSSingle::singleevent_deliver_ = 0;
2754  KSSingle::singleevent_move_ = 0;
2755 
2756  // SelfEvents need to be "freed". Other kinds of DiscreteEvents may
2757  // already have gone out of existence so the tqe_ may contain many
2758  // invalid item data pointers
2759  HocEvent::reclaim();
2760  allthread_hocevents_->remove_all();
2761  nrn_allthread_handle = nil;
2762 #if USENEOSIM
2763  if (p_nrn2neosim_send) for (i=0; i < nlist_; ++i) {
2764  TQueue* tq = p.lcv_[i].neosim_self_events_;
2765  while(tq->least()) { tq->remove(tq->least());}
2766  // and have already been reclaimed by SelfEvent::reclaim()
2767  }
2768 #endif
2769  if (!MUTCONSTRUCTED) {MUTCONSTRUCT(1);}
2770  enqueueing_ = 0;
2771  for (i=0; i < nrn_nthread; ++i) {
2772  NetCvodeThreadData& d = p[i];
2773  delete d.tqe_;
2774  d.tqe_ = new TQueue(p[i].tpool_);
2775  d.unreffed_event_cnt_ = 0;
2776  d.sepool_->free_all();
2777  d.immediate_deliver_ = -1e100;
2778  d.ite_cnt_ = 0;
2779  if (nrn_use_selfqueue_) {
2780  if (!d.selfqueue_) {
2781  d.selfqueue_ = new SelfQueue(d.tpool_, 0);
2782  }else{
2783  d.selfqueue_->remove_all();
2784  }
2785  }
2786 #if BBTQ == 5
2787  d.tqe_->nshift_ = -1;
2788  d.tqe_->shift_bin(nt_t);
2789 #endif
2790  }
2791  // I don't believe this is needed anymore since cvode not needed
2792  // til delivery.
2793  if (cvode_active_) { // in case there is a net_send from INITIAL cvode
2794  // then this needs to be done before INITIAL blocks are called
2795  init_global();
2796  }
2797 }
2798 
2799 void NetCvode::init_events() {
2800  hoc_Item* q;
2801  int i, j;
2802  double fifodelay;
2803 #if BBTQ == 5
2804  for (i=0; i < nrn_nthread; ++i) {
2805  p[i].tqe_->nshift_ = -1;
2806  p[i].tqe_->shift_bin(nt_t);
2807  }
2808 #endif
2809  if (psl_) {
2810  ITERATE(q, psl_) {
2811  PreSyn* ps = (PreSyn*)VOIDITM(q);
2812  ps->init();
2813  ps->flag_ = false;
2814  NetConPList& dil = ps->dil_;
2815  ps->use_min_delay_ = 0;
2816 #if USE_MIN_DELAY
2817  // also decide what to do about use_min_delay_
2818  // the rule for now is to use it if all delays are
2819  // the same and there are more than 2
2820 #if BBTQ == 3 || BBTQ == 4
2821  // but
2822  // if we desire nrn_use_fifo_queue_ then use it
2823  // even if just one
2824  if (nrn_use_fifo_queue_) {
2825  if (dil.count()) {
2826  ps->use_min_delay_ = 1;
2827  ps->delay_ = dil.item(0)->delay_;
2828  fifodelay = ps->delay_;
2829  }
2830  }else
2831 #endif // BBTQ
2832  {
2833  if (dil.count() > 2) {
2834  ps->use_min_delay_ = 1;
2835  ps->delay_ = dil.item(0)->delay_;
2836  }
2837  }
2838 #endif // USE_MIN_DELAY
2839 
2840  for (i=dil.count()-1; i >= 0; --i) {
2841  NetCon* d = dil.item(i);
2842  if (ps->use_min_delay_ && ps->delay_ != d->delay_) {
2843  ps->use_min_delay_ = false;
2844  }
2845 #if BBTQ == 3 || BBTQ == 4
2846  if (nrn_use_fifo_queue_ && d->delay_ != fifodelay) {
2847 hoc_warning("Use of the event fifo queue is turned off due to more than one value for NetCon.delay", 0);
2848  nrn_use_fifo_queue_ = false;
2849  }
2850 #endif
2851  }
2852  }
2853  }
2854  // iterate over all NetCon in creation order to call
2855  // NETRECEIVE INITIAL blocks.
2856  static hoc_List* nclist = NULL;
2857  if (!nclist) {
2858  Symbol* sym = hoc_lookup("NetCon");
2859  nclist = sym->u.ctemplate->olist;
2860  }
